content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No new structures have been successfully built on the map. All attempted placements of a Lab at position (0.5, 2.5) have failed due to inventory shortages and unresolved crafting dependencies. Although processing facilities (furnaces) were accessed during smelting operations—such as the furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) for iron plate production and the copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) for copper plate production—none of these were constructed by the agent as dedicated structures.

ERROR TIPS
• API Parameter Usage – When calling get_entities(), use the correct parameters. The function does not accept a keyword like “radius” and must not be provided with extra positional arguments.
• Safe Entity Handling – Always verify that the result from an entity retrieval call is a valid collection (or default to an empty list) before iterating over it to avoid “NoneType” iteration errors.
• Lab Placement Verification – Before attempting to place a Lab, confirm that the Lab is available in your inventory. Failing to do so leads to placement errors.
• Crafting Chain Dependencies – Ensure that every sub-ingredient required for crafting a Lab (including iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) is available. Validate that each production step—such as smelting or assembling intermediate components—is functional and sufficiently resourced before initiating Lab crafting.
• Resource Quantity Checks – Double-check that required ingredient counts (for example, additional iron-gear-wheels when shortages are reported) are met prior to crafting to prevent recipe failures.
